Class DrawBinaryTree

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  DrawBinaryTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class DrawBinaryTree
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Draw a binary tree with in a JPanel pane. This pane may be displayed in its own window or within a split pane. The actual binary tree drawing takes place in the binary tree class. This class is responsible for defining the window parameters and launching the binary tree drawing process.

Version:
1.0 2005-OCT-21
Author:
Rob Bauer
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DrawBinaryTree

public DrawBinaryTree()
A generic constructor. At least setup the window pane.

DrawBinaryTree

public DrawBinaryTree(java.lang.String givenfloorplan)
Specify the floor plan to be loaded in the tree. Then find some facts about the tree (depth, node count, and the in-order traversal string).

Parameters:
givenfloorplan - String containing the floor plan in pre-order order.
Method Detail

setupPanel

private void setupPanel()
Setup the window pane.

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Perform the actual tree drawing on the panel. Defines the drawing parameters and draws the tree as well as draws the status bar. If the window gets resized or needs redrawing, this method will refresh the drawing.

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
See Also:
JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

drawStatusBar

private void drawStatusBar(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draw the status bar. Paints a box at the bottom of the window and lets the user know about the floor plan used.

Parameters:
g - Graphics2D to draw with

drawTree

private void drawTree(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                      BinaryTree drawtree)
Draw the given binary tree. Defines the center of the window as well as what the horizontal and vertical spacing is available to fit all the nodes in the window. This code allows the tree to grow and shrink when the window is resized. Horizontal space is determined by the number of nodes needed to draw and the available horizontal space. The vertical space is determined by the depth of the tree and the amount of avaialble vertical space. Also take into account the border space between the window itself and the drawing of the tree.

Parameters:
g - Graphics2D to draw with
drawtree - BinaryTree to draw

getBoxDimension

private int getBoxDimension(int x,
                            int y)
Take x spacing and y spacing and figure out which one is the smaller, then divide in the box size.

Parameters:
x - width of the box
y - height of the box
Returns:
new height based on the given x and y values

getCenterPoint

private java.awt.Point getCenterPoint()
Calculate the center point of the window.

Returns:
Point containing the coordinates to the center of the window
